result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn D Volkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
AMENDED 01-04-2016:  Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: to present sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.
Mental Health evaulation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with victim, Jessica V.
Domestic violence counseling.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shawn D Volkman in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1.5 years, Extended Supervision: .5 years)  Stayed for 1 year Probation - consecutive to present sentence defendant is serving
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with victim Jessica V. Domestic Violence counseling. Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
